abstract: Liberia lifts its curfew but its border with Sierra Leone remains closed, due to Ebola fears; outbreak has diminished, with only a few cases reported in recent weeks.
lead_paragraph: Sierra Leonean authorities said Sunday that they had received no instructions to open their side of the border with Liberia, sealed in late July to try to limit the spread of the Ebola virus.

headline.main: Liberia Lifts Its Curfew, but Border Stays Sealed
headline.print_headline: Liberia Lifts Its Curfew, but Border Stays Sealed

snippet: Sierra Leonean authorities said Sunday that they had received no instructions to open their side of the border with Liberia, sealed in late July to try to limit the spread of the Ebola virus.
